## ðŸ“– Lecture

Many data sets (e.g. `storms` data set from `"dplyr"`) contain geographical variables such as **longitude** and **latitude** that can be visualized with a map.
This week we take `"ggplot2"` a further step to learn how to plot basic maps with some dedicated packages such as `"sf"` and `"rnaturalearth"`.
Likewise, we'll also discuss how to produce web-interactive maps with the package `"leaflet"`.
